basics.name: Collins Ogbodo
basics.label: Doctoral Researcher
basics.summary: Innovative Digital Twin Systems Engineer with 3+ years of experience integrating physics-based and AI-driven models for system monitoring, decision support, and performance optimization. Skilled at integrating structural dynamics and energy engineering with machine learning to deliver impactful solutions across aerospace, energy, and smart infrastructure sectors. Proven technical leadership in high-impact research and industrial projects. Eager to leverage this expertise to drive innovation and operational excellence in next-generation intelligent systems.

work.name: University Of Sheffield, Sheffield, United Kingdom
highlights: Hub leader for the 2025 EYH and GEC events, managed the project AI Solutions for Engineering, guiding and mentoring 36 students per event in developing AI-driven solutions for engineering challenges and ensured high quality student engagement and experience as indicated by an average final grade of 80%.
Leading and supporting practical experiments and computational model development for structural and vibration engineering using Matlab, python and Ansys.

Actively contributed within a team as a test engineer to successfully complete a comprehensive BAE hawk full body structural dynamic test funded by the Alan Turing Institute Research and Innovation Cluster for Digital Twins and EPSRC which resulted in an open source, high-quality dataset to facilitate data-drive research and innovation.

work.name: Tion Global, Moscow, Russia
highlights: Developed simulation based digital twin for increased monitoring and predictive capability of HVAC systems using Ansys Twin Builder. The model was used for predetermination of optimal number of units to deploy in an office buildings based on air quality impact metric which led to 4.3% reduction in energy consumption.

Led a team of student energy engineer in the development of a digital twin implementation strategy of HVAC systems to guide and facilitate the company’s integration of digital twin technology into its operation.

work.name: Alon Technical Service Limited, Port Harcourt, Nigeria
highlights: Managed within a team the analysis and fabrication of 1.03km 6” pipeline leading to project completion with 97% of target.
Supervised the design and fabrication of a Shell shaker, mud tanks, batch mixer and degasser, ensuring the project completion at the plan date.

work.name: University of Port Harcourt (Uniport), Port Harcourt, Nigeria
highlights: Analysed and modelled vibration system with high nonlinear behaviour using classical semi-analytic and numerical methods resulting the co-authoring of 3 peer reviewed publication.
Simulated modelled dynamic system using Wolfram Mathematica to understand system asymptotic behaviours.

work.name: Penser L’ Avenir, Port Harcourt, Nigeria
highlights: Systems engineering department lead - Managed all systems engineering project involving development of Matlab and AVEVA PDMS models.
Produced project equipment design for oil, gas and subsea for large engineering firms like TechDaer and Chess Subsea using SolidWorks.
Developed mathematical model for concrete constituent substitution which reduced project cost and duration significantly using Matlab.
